@TheDisfigured can't agree more...There is a reason why i still go back and play my NES/SNES/Gen etc where now games i enjoy are few and far between.

author: Raukuu

text: That''s not what makes you a hardcore gamer though. What makes you a hardcore gamer is broadening your horizons. Playing more then just shooting games. I would consider a hardcore gamer of this age someone who plays a bit of Call of Duty there, a bit of fl0wer here, some Marvel vs Capcom, God of War, Shadow of the Colossus. It's about having a variety. Not about Being old school. Call of Duty, Halo, and UFC take no brain power what so ever. In some terms, you are correct, to them it is a hobby.

text:
A good sign of a hardcore gamer?I'd say about 100 games and you're a candidate for hardcore gamer.Another sign is if amongest those games are plenty of geat games that no one knows about like this.
I'd consider myself one.Been into games since I was 2,I've played well over 500 games and still own over half of them,the majority of them no one I know seems to know but when you check into them they're classics(Battletoads for example),and owning every system to date.Let's see Guitar boy top that!
